meanings.definition: To spend more money than (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: She always outspends her friends when they go shopping together.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman outspends his competitors to stay ahead in the market.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outspends the other animals in the forest when it comes to collecting nuts.
meanings.sent4: His generosity outspends his income, leaving him in financial trouble.
meanings.sent5: The extravagant queen outspends the entire royal court with her lavish parties.

meanings.sent1: The company outspends its budget every quarter, causing financial strain.
meanings.sent2: During the holiday season, she always outspends her savings on gifts for her family.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner outspends his energy too early in the race and struggles to finish.
meanings.sent4: The river outspends its banks during the heavy rains, causing flooding in the area.
meanings.sent5: The student outspends his study time on video games, leading to poor grades.
